snippet: The mayor’s long-term strategy to combat homelessness, a problem whose magnitude he has called “unacceptable,” has not kept pace with the flow of women, men and children streaming into shelters.

byline.original: By NIKITA STEWART and J. DAVID GOODMAN

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is wrestling with homelessness that has seen stark rise over past two years; more people are entering shelters and staying longer with some 57,448 people, more than 40 percent of them children, currently sleeping in city shelters; de Blasio's vow to reduce homelessness has gone largely unfulfilled, though he has defended efforts.
lead_paragraph: The mayor’s long-term strategy to combat homelessness, a problem whose magnitude he has called “unacceptable,” has not kept pace with the flow of women, men and children streaming into shelters.

headline.print_headline: Mayor Struggles to Slow a Surge in Homelessness
headline.main: Despite Vow, Mayor de Blasio Struggles to Curb Homelessness
